description.zh-cn: 中华民国台湾省形式上的最高行政机关。1998年虚级化后，功能与业务大幅缩减并转移，成为行政院的派出机关。2018年7月1日起实施“去任务化”，预算归零，业务与员额由中央政府相关部会承接。
description.en: The de jure highest administrative organ of Taiwan Province, Republic of China. After being streamlined in 1998, its functions and operations were significantly reduced and transferred, becoming a dispatched agency of the Executive Yuan. From July 1, 2018, it was 'de-tasked', its budget was zeroed out, and its duties and staff were taken over by relevant central government ministries.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的最高行政机关。
description.en: The highest executive organ of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 台湾省政府的前身机构，因其施政引发民怨，在二二八事件后被改制。
description.en: The predecessor body of the Taiwan Provincial Government, which was reorganized after the 228 Incident due to public grievances against its administration.

description.zh-cn: 1947年发生在台湾的官民冲突事件，此事件促使国民政府将台湾省行政长官公署改制为台湾省政府。
description.en: A conflict between officials and civilians that occurred in Taiwan in 1947. This incident prompted the Nationalist Government to reorganize the Taiwan Provincial Administrative Executive Office into the Taiwan Provincial Government.

description.zh-cn: 1925年至1948年间中华民国的中央政府，在二二八事件后决定改组台湾的省级行政机关。
description.en: The central government of the Republic of China from 1925 to 1948, which decided to reorganize Taiwan's provincial administrative body after the 228 Incident.

nodes.id: 台湾省政府功能业务与组织调整

zh-cn: 台湾省政府功能业务与组织调整
en: Functional and Organizational Restructuring of the Taiwan Provincial Government

description.zh-cn: 一项旨在简化地方政府层级的政治改革，导致台湾省政府被“虚级化”，丧失地方自治功能。
description.en: A political reform aimed at simplifying local government tiers, which led to the 'streamlining' of the Taiwan Provincial Government and the loss of its local self-government functions.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国昔日的最高政权机关之一。1997年通过宪法增修条文，为台湾省虚级化提供了法源。
description.en: Formerly one of the highest organs of state power in the Republic of China. In 1997, it passed additional articles of the Constitution, providing the legal basis for the streamlining of Taiwan Province.

nodes.id: 中华民国国家发展委员会

zh-cn: 中华民国国家发展委员会

description.zh-cn: 中华民国有关国家发展的最高主管机关。2018年接管了原台湾省政府的剩余业务与人员。
description.en: The highest authority for national development in the Republic of China. In 2018, it took over the remaining duties and personnel of the former Taiwan Provincial Government.

description.zh-cn: 一个政治团体，其支持者曾于2014年占领台湾省政府大楼。
description.en: A political group whose supporters occupied the Taiwan Provincial Government building in 2014.

description.zh-cn: 美国台湾政府的支持者，曾率众占领台湾省政府大楼。
description.en: A supporter of the United States Taiwan Government who led a group to occupy the Taiwan Provincial Government building.

description.zh-cn: 原隶属于台湾省政府的资料馆，省政府去任务化后改隶国家发展委员会档案管理局。
description.en: An archives originally affiliated with the Taiwan Provincial Government, which was re-subordinated to the National Archives Administration of the National Development Council after the provincial government was de-tasked.

nodes.id: 国家发展委员会档案管理局

zh-cn: 国家发展委员会档案管理局
en: National Archives Administration, National Development Council

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国家发展委员会的附属机关，负责国家档案管理。
description.en: An affiliated agency of the National Development Council of the Republic of China, responsible for national archives management.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国法理上的一个省，其实际管辖范围在多次行政区划调整后已大幅缩小，并于1998年虚级化。
description.en: A de jure province of the Republic of China. Its actual jurisdiction has been significantly reduced after multiple administrative division adjustments and was streamlined in 1998.

description.zh-cn: 台湾省政府所属的国家。
description.en: The state to which the Taiwan Provincial Government belongs.

description.zh-cn: 位于台湾南投市，曾是台湾省政府的驻地。
description.en: Located in Nantou City, Taiwan, it was formerly the seat of the Taiwan Provincial Government.

description.zh-cn: 现为行政院办公地点，在1945年至1956年间曾是台湾省行政长官公署及台湾省政府的办公厅舍。
description.en: Currently the office of the Executive Yuan, it served as the office building for the Taiwan Provincial Administrative Executive Office and the Taiwan Provincial Government from 1945 to 1956.

description.zh-cn: 时任中华民国国家发展委员会主任委员，于2018年宣布台湾省政府去任务化。
description.en: Then-Minister of the National Development Council of the Republic of China, who announced the de-tasking of the Taiwan Provincial Government in 2018.

description.zh-cn: 台湾省政府首长的职衔之一，于1994年至1998年间由民选产生。
description.en: A title for the head of the Taiwan Provincial Government, who was popularly elected between 1994 and 1998.

description.zh-cn: 台湾省政府由台湾省行政长官公署改制而成，是其后继机关。
description.en: The Taiwan Provincial Government was reorganized from the Taiwan Provincial Administrative Executive Office and is its successor.

description.zh-cn: 二二八事件爆发后，国民政府为平息民怨，决定废除台湾省行政长官公署，并改制为台湾省政府。
description.en: After the outbreak of the 228 Incident, the Nationalist Government decided to abolish the Taiwan Provincial Administrative Executive Office and reorganize it into the Taiwan Provincial Government to appease public resentment.

description.zh-cn: 国民政府于1947年4月22日召开行政院会议，决议将台湾省行政长官公署改制为台湾省政府。
description.en: The Nationalist Government held an Executive Yuan Council meeting on April 22, 1947, and resolved to reorganize the Taiwan Provincial Administrative Executive Office into the Taiwan Provincial Government.

description.zh-cn: 自1998年台湾省虚级化后，台湾省政府成为行政院的派出机关，直接隶属于行政院。
description.en: Since the streamlining of Taiwan Province in 1998, the Taiwan Provincial Government became a dispatched agency of the Executive Yuan and was directly subordinate to it.

relationships.source: 台湾省政府功能业务与组织调整

description.zh-cn: 此项政策调整导致台湾省政府被虚级化，业务大幅缩减并丧失地方自治机关功能。
description.en: This policy adjustment led to the streamlining of the Taiwan Provincial Government, significantly reducing its operations and stripping it of its functions as a local self-governing body.

relationships.target: 台湾省政府功能业务与组织调整

description.zh-cn: 1997年，国民大会通过宪法增修条文，为台湾省的虚级化（即台湾省政府功能业务与组织调整）提供了法律基础。
description.en: In 1997, the National Assembly passed additional articles of the Constitution, providing the legal basis for the streamlining of Taiwan Province (i.e., the Functional and Organizational Restructuring of the Taiwan Provincial Government).

relationships.source: 中华民国国家发展委员会

description.zh-cn: 自2018年7月1日起，台湾省政府的剩余业务与员额移交给国家发展委员会，实施“去任务化”，使其运作实质上终结。
description.en: Starting July 1, 2018, the remaining duties and personnel of the Taiwan Provincial Government were handed over to the National Development Council, implementing a 'de-tasking' that effectively ended its operations.

description.zh-cn: 2014年7月7日，美国台湾政府的支持者占领了台湾省政府大楼。
description.en: On July 7, 2014, supporters of the United States Taiwan Government occupied the Taiwan Provincial Government building.

description.zh-cn: 率领约百名美国台湾政府支持者占领台湾省政府大楼。
description.en: Led about one hundred supporters of the United States Taiwan Government to occupy the Taiwan Provincial Government building.

relationships.target: 国家发展委员会档案管理局

description.zh-cn: 在台湾省政府去任务化后，台湾省政资料馆改隶属于国家发展委员会档案管理局。
description.en: After the de-tasking of the Taiwan Provincial Government, the Taiwan Provincial Archives was re-subordinated to the National Archives Administration of the National Development Council.

description.zh-cn: 台湾省是中华民国法理上的一个省份。
description.en: Taiwan Province is a de jure province of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 台湾省政府是台湾省的最高行政机关。
description.en: The Taiwan Provincial Government was the highest administrative organ of Taiwan Province.

description.zh-cn: 台湾省政府于1957年至2018年间设址于南投市中兴新村。
description.en: The Taiwan Provincial Government was located in Zhongxing New Village, Nantou City, from 1957 to 2018.

description.zh-cn: 台湾省政府（及其前身）于1945年至1956年间在今行政院中央大楼办公。
description.en: The Taiwan Provincial Government (and its predecessor) was located in what is now the Executive Yuan Central Building from 1945 to 1956.

relationships.target: 中华民国国家发展委员会

description.zh-cn: 陈美伶在2018年担任国家发展委员会主任委员时宣布台湾省政府去任务化。
description.en: Chen Mei-ling announced the de-tasking of the Taiwan Provincial Government in 2018 while serving as Minister of the National Development Council.

description.zh-cn: 在1994年至1998年间，台湾省政府的最高长官由官派的“主席”改为民选的“省长”。
description.en: Between 1994 and 1998, the head of the Taiwan Provincial Government was changed from an appointed 'Chairman' to an elected 'Governor'.
